key_title: Key to the species of Isolepis

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the genera of Cyperaceae

source.author: Wilson, K.L.
source.title: Cyperaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Wilson, K.L. (1994). Cyperaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Spikelet flattened; glumes distichously arranged
Spikelet terete or somewhat flattened; glumes spirally arranged
Style 2-fid
Style 3-fid (rarely 2-fid in I. trachysperma)
Culms weak, long and leafy in water or erect to decumbent on land; spikelet always solitary and erect, often exceeding the involucral bract
Culms usually erect, to 45 cm high; spikelets 1–15, usually exceeded by the the involucral bract
Spikelets ovate to broad-elliptic in outline, 12–40- flowered, 5–9 mm long; glumes 3–4 mm long; leaf blades somewhat thick, with more than 4 longitudinal veins distinct
Spikelets more or less elliptic in outline, slender, 5- 10 (– 15)-flowered, 3–5 mm long; glumes 1.7–3 mm long; leaf blades not thick, with 3(–)4 longitudinal veins distinct
Glumes 1.7–2.8 mm long, occasionally with red-brown patches; stamens 2 (rarely 3); anthers 0.5–1.0 mm long; nut broad-obovoid to ellipsoid, angles not ribbed
Glumes 2.5–3.3 mm long, usually dark red-brown to blackish; stamens 3; anthers 1.5–2.7 mm long; nut obovoid with angles slightly ribbed
Spikelet 1, not proliferating; stamens 2 or rarely 3; nut 1.4–1.8 mm long
Spikelets usually 3–15 per inflorescence, spreading, often proliferating; stamens 1 or rarely 2; nut 0.7–1 mm long
Spikelets squarrose; glumes with awn about as long as body; nut about one-third as long as glume body
Spikelets not squarrose; glumes not long-awned, occasionally shortly mucronate; nut mostly at least half as long as glume (except in I. congrua and I. victoriensis)
Nut longitudinally striate and transversely trabeculate
Nut surface smooth or minutely reticulate, pitted or verrucose
Glumes 1.5–2 mm long; spikelets 3–15; stamen 1 (rarely 2); nut straw-coloured
Glumes 1.0–1.5 mm long; spikelets 1 or 2 (rarely more); stamens usually 3; nut white to blackish, opalescent
Slender perennial with numerous spikelets clustered in a ± dense head, usually proliferating; culms 1–3 mm diam
Small perennials or annuals with 1–15 spikelets per inflorescence, sometimes proliferating; culms mostly filiform, usually less than 1 mm diam
Stamens 3
Stamens 1 or 2
Nut less than 0.7 mm long
Nut 0.7–1.5 mm long
Nut straw-coloured to dark red-brown; glumes 0.8–1.2 mm long, with sides nerveless or rarely with 1 nerve at edge of keel
Nut dark brown to black; glumes 1–1.5 mm long, with sides irregularly but conspicuously 2–5-nerved
Plant with leaves to twice as long as culms and involucral bracts same length as culms
Plants with leaves and involucral bracts shorter than culms
Glumes obtuse
Glumes acute
Nut with angles not well-defined or rounded, dark brown to black, 0.5–0.8 mm long; tufted annual or possibly short-lived perennial
Nut with angles well-defined, pale yellow to dark grey-brown to brown, 0.7–1.1 mm long; perennials, mostly shortly rhizomatous
Nut yellow-brown to dark grey-brown to brown, one-half to two-thirds as long as glume;glumes mostly straw-coloured to orange- or red-brown
Nut pale yellow to pale red-brown, about seven-eighths as long as glume; glumes straw-coloured tinged dark red-brown to mostly dark red-brown
Nut terete, about half as long as glume; involucral bract shorter than or barely exceeding the inflorescence
Nut distinctly angular, about one-thrid or greater than two thirds the length of the glume; involucral bract exceeding the inflorescence
Nut unequally trigonous, remaining on bare axis after glumes and involucral bracts fall
Nut equally trigonous, not remaining on bare axis
Nut 0.4–0.6 mm long
Nut 0.7–1.5 mm long
Glumes with sides opaque, nerves 3 or 4 spread over side
Glumes with sides markedly hyaline, nerves absent or 1 on each side close to keel
Glumes 1.2–2 mm long; spikelets 2–7 per inflorescence, 3.5–6 mm long; involucral bract 1–6 cm long (often as long as culm); nut straw-coloured
Glumes 0.5–1 mm long; spikelets 1–3 per inflorescence, 1.5–3 mm long; involucral bract less than 1 cm long; nut dark brown to black

Hyaline sides of glumes 0.4–0.6 mm wide, with the cell outlines clearly visible at 15–20 X magnification (cells usually c. 0.1 mm long, 0.05 mm wide); glumes 1.5–2 mm long (rarely as short as 1.3 mm); nut broad-ellipsoid to broad obovoid, with the sides ± concave, the angles acute, prominent; leaf-blades often 4–9 cm long

Hyaline sides of glumes 0.2–0.3 (–0.4) mm wide, with inconspicuous cell outlines; glumes 0.8–1.6 mm long; nut obovoid to broad-obovoid, with the sides convex or flat, the angles obtuse; leaf-blades usually less than 3 cm long

Glumes usually hyaline tinged dark red-brown, 0.8–1.2 mm long, nerveless or rarely with 1 nerve close to the keel on each side; nut from one-half to twothirds as long as glume, pale brown to dark red-brown

Glumes usually hyaline, rarely with red-brown patches, 1.1–1.6 mm long, with 1 nerve at the keel margin on each side; nut c. one-third as long as glume, white with underlying red-brown to blackish colouring at maturity
Leaves to twice as long as culms; involucral bracts 1–6 cm long, from one-third to as long as culms
Leaves and involucral bracts shorter than the culms (bracts to 2 cm long)
Nut 0.6–0.8 mm long, more or less equally trigonous, with angles well-defined, straw-coloured, minutely punctate, glistening; spikelets 2–8 per inflorescence

Nut 0.9–1.3 mm long, unequally trigonous, with angles not well-defined, straw-coloured to grey-brown, smooth with a minutely reticulate pattern under the surface, shining; spikelets 1–3 per inflorescence
Glumes with the broad keel produced in a relatively stout excurved or straight mucro
Glumes minutely mucronate or with the keel not produced at all
Hyaline sides of glumes 0.4–0.6 mm wide, with the cell outlines clearly visible at 15–20 X magnification, nerveless or with 1 nerve close to keel; nut equally trigonous
Hyaline sides of glumes 0.2–0.3 (–0.4) mm wide, with inconspicuous cell outlines, 1–3-nerved; nut unequally trigonous
Nut terete, globose, reticulate, distinctly tuberculate
Nut trigonous, rarely biconvex, often reticulate, sometimes minutely roughened
Glumes straw-coloured to orange-brown or red-brown; nut yellow-brown to dark grey-brown; inflorescence not proliferating
Glumes straw-coloured with dark red-brown patches to uniformly dark red-brown; nut pale yellow to pale red-brown; inflorescence often proliferating
Leaves usually reduced to mucro on sheath; spikelets usually 3–15 per inflorescence; nut from one-half to two-thirds as long as glume; inflorescence often proliferating
Leaves with well-developed blades; spikelets 1–3 per inflorescence; nut more than two-thirds the length of the glume; inflorescence occasionally proliferating
Nut ± equally trigonous, 0.8–1.4 mm long, 0.6–0.8 mm diam., c. three-quarters as long as glume; glumes 1.3–1.8 mm long; culms 7–30 cm high
Nut ± unequally trigonous, 0.7–1 mm long, 0.5–0.7 mm diam., c. seven-eighths as long as glume; glumes 0.8–1.3 mm long; culms to 10 cm high
